intro: Cincinalis caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed cincinalis, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring elongated, trailing stems and striking, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support in its natural habitat. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Cincinalis caudata is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
